reviews.title: Great Hotel !!
reviews.text: Very Good hotel, even for me as a Dutch guy who wanted to see more of Delft, this is a perfect hotel in the middle of the centre. Nice ambiance, nice staff, they even have a Johannes Vermeer beer !! And ask for the pizza when you're sitting outside with te wonderfull view ..........need i say more ??

This hotel is in the very best location for visiting Delft. It is right in the heart of the city. Just step outside and you are straight away where you need to be to see the sites, go shopping or have a drink or a meal. For this alone it is great, but the hotel is also very comfy and the staff very friendly and helpful. The bar has two beers brewed just for the hotel.
reviews.title: Brilliant location

reviews.text: The location is also a drawback if you have luggage. It is very difficult or even impossible to drive to the hotel because of where it is so you need to leave your car in the car park on the edge of the centre and walk from there. This is not ideal for those carrying a lot of luggage. Also the hotel has no lift so you have to climb the steep stairs with your luggage. Best recommended for those who are reasonably fit.
reviews.title: A gem in Delft

reviews.text: Wonderful hotel in a charming town. Classy from the moment you walk through the door. Clean and bright with great cozy bar and eating area. Needed a quad and plenty of room for my wife and I and our two teenage kids. Room was perfect with access to rooftop deck. Staff was helpful and friendly. A great stay in Delft. You won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: The Hotel with the Pearl Earring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great location - walking distance from the train station and quite near the central square. My family and I had the 4 person "apartment" that was very comfortable. Breakfast was very good and we found the staff to be very helpful.
reviews.title: A view of the canal

likes.disliked: — Parking three blocks away in the parking garage.

reviews.text: Hotel Vermeer is in a convenient central location - on a pedestrianised canalside, but a taxi can drop you within about 50 metres of the hotel. At the time we were there - November 2011 - some areas of Delft were in construction turmoil caused by inserting a new underground train line, so the taxi ride from the station is quite a long detour; but it's a relatively easy walk from/to the station. The construction does not affect the old centre. The hotel is well located for the bars, restaurants and markets, and a nearby new shopping centre.
reviews.title: Excellent (but a gloomy room)

reviews.text: The hotel is clean and comfortable, with lounge sitting space on the ground floor, where a good breakfast is served. We were in a first-floor room at the back, which was large and comfortable, but unfortunately gloomy because of the trees blocking the window and the electric lighting was also low-level and poorly provided. There is no lift. The main stair is OK and straight, but the stair from first to second floor is a typical narrow winding Dutch stair which we were glad we did not have to climb.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: Spent a week here for business. Room clean and comfortable - lots of space and bathroom modern. Generous breakfast and friendly staff. Located on a street with a canal and only a couple of blocks from the mains square - you can walk to all of the attractions. Train station about a ten minute walk
reviews.title: A perfect relaxing break

reviews.text: We have just enjoyed a "beauty package" at the Hotel Vermeer in Delft. Was great. The package included afternoon tea, 30 min back massage and 30 min facial - was wonderful. Went to a great Mexican restaurant around the corner for dinner - we ate and drank very well!
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definitely recommend the hotel. We were in room 14 I believe - large double bed and shower on suite. Quiet. Excellent value.
reviews.title: A good pick

reviews.text: This hotel is very centrally located and the breakfast room and bar area are nice and well decorated however the bedrooms and en-suites are a little dated. I had a small double bed in my room but with a single bed duvet on it which looked a little strange. There are no tea and coffee making facilities in your room and no minibar. After reading the other reviews of this hotel I was expecting it to be a rather nice place to stay but it did not live up to the expectations set by the other reviews. The breakfast was ok, just continental breakfast with the offer of scrambled or boiled egg and bacon. The bacon was extremley salty. If I ever return to Delft again I think I would rather stay in another hotel. There is no lift and the rooms located upstairs are very hazardous to get to especially with luggage. My colleagues room was up a very steep set of narrow winding stairs.
reviews.title: comfortable but not as nice as I was expecting

reviews.text: The hotel is very well located in the centre of Delft, just far enough away from the main square to avoid night time noise. The public areas are beautiful and the staff very helpful. The bedrooms were large and well presented. The breakfast was very nice, with a choice of cereals, pastries and a cooked breakfast. Charlie the hotel parrot is very sweet!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel
one word- "wow" (sharon and ido- israel)
reviews.text: The hotel parking is located a few minutes walk away in a large public car park (10 euros per day if paid at the hotel). It would have been helpful to have had details of the location of the parking prior to arrival, as the pedestrianised one way streets proved to be quite hard work to navigate by car.

great hospitality, rich and tastefull breakfast, smiling managers, rooms with taste of luxury,we took the top room- with view to the cathedral- a view of romantic legend.most clean hotel,you have to book......
reviews.title: Great Centrally Located Hotel

reviews.text: we found this hotel by luck- and we aregratefull for that.one big smile on delft face.
reviews.title: Great location, big room, friendly staff, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location, cleanliness, comfort and hotel staff were superior and the value was very reasonable.
reviews.title: Superior location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Johannes Vermeer is located on a canal within walking distance of all the major sites in Delft. We loved eating our lunch in front of the hotel on the canal and watching the bicyclists and pedestrians go by. We could easily walk to restaurants nearby. We enjoyed eating stroopwafels from the Stroopwafelwinkel cart across the canal. Each room is well-furnished and includes a print of a Vermeer painting. There is no lift available, but hotel staff were very helpful in carrying our luggage to our room. The hotel offers generous discounts for parking at the parking garage at the edge of town.
reviews.title: Great staff and location, but could use some improvements

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only drawback was the view of the construction across the canal.
reviews.title: A gem of a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Vermeer is an adorable hotel right on one of the canals in the center of town. The location is fantastic - we were close to everything. The staff were all extremely helpful with information on metro tickets and train schedules, arranging for taxi pickup, making sure we could get some food before our 6:30 am checkout time (to catch a train to catch a plane) and with any other questions we had.
reviews.title: Great stay, very helpfull, few improvements to make...

reviews.text: The bathroom had a deep and large tub, which we didn't use as they had a separate shower. The hotel also has free wifi in the lobby area, free sodas and water in the upstairs frig and a decent breakfast.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay at Johannes Vermeer Hotel!
